description:
Lightweight APM dashboard for monitoring OpenTelemetry-based services.  

Instrument your applications using OpenTelemetry SDKs and send traces, metrics, and logs to Tempo for traces, a Prometheus-compatible database like Mimir for metrics, and Loki for logs. This dashboard provides a centralized view of your application's health and performance.  

For a fully managed observability stack, consider using Grafana Cloud.  

Learn more about this dashboard on https://github.com/cyrille-leclerc/opentelemetry-service-dashboard.

panels.description: Shows the timestamp of the latest metrics received in the past 24h.

targets.expr: timestamp(sum by (service_namespace, service_name) (target_info{service_namespace="$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}) or absent{})

panels.title: Latest metrics received

panels.description: Shows the timestamp of the latest logs received in the past 24h.
panels.title: Latest logs received

panels.description: Shows the timestamp of the latest span received in the past 24h.
panels.title: Latest traces received

panels.description:
HTTP endpoints aggregation on the `http.server.request.duration` metric.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration
panels.title: Duration

panels.description:
HTTP endpoints aggregation on the `http.server.request.duration` metric. 

Errors are identified by   `http.response.status_code=~"5.."`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration

targets.expr: (sum without(http_status_code, error_type, instance) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{service_namespace="$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", status_code="STATUS_CODE_ERROR"}[$__rate_interval])) * 100) / sum without(http_status_code, error_type, instance) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{service_name="$service_name", service_namespace="$service_namespace"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Error

panels.description:
HTTP endpoints aggregation on the `http.server.request.duration` metric.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration
panels.title: Request Rate

panels.description:
Inbound HTTP operations of the service (aka HTTP endpoints) based on the `http.server.request.duration` metric.

Errors are identified by `http.response.status_code=~"5.."`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration

targets.expr:
(
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name", http_response_status_code=~"5.."}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{job=~"$service_namespace/$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )
    )

panels.title: HTTP Operations

panels.description:
HTTP calls made by the service based on the `http.client.request.duration` metric.

Calls broken done by remote `server.address` and by `http.request.method`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpclientrequestduration

targets.expr:
(
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{service_namespace="$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", server_address!=""}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                " ",
                "server_address",
                "http_request_method",
                "url_template"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{service_namespace="$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", server_address!=""}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                " ",
                "server_address",
                "http_request_method",
                "url_template"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{service_namespace="$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", server_address!=""}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                " ",
                "server_address",
                "http_request_method",
                "url_template"
            )
        )
    )

histogram_quantile(
    0.99,
    sum by (le, outbound_service) (
        label_join(
        rate(http_client_request_duration_seconds_bucket{service_namespace="$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", server_address!=""}[5m]),
        "outbound_service",
        " ",
        "server_address",
        "http_request_method",
        "url_template"
        )
    )
)

panels.title: Outbound HTTP Services

panels.description:
DB calls made by the service based on the `db.client.operation.duration` metric.

Calls broken down by `server.address` and `db.namespace`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/database/database-metrics/#metric-dbclientoperationduration

targets.expr:
(
        sum by (database) (
            label_join(
                rate(db_client_operation_duration_seconds_count{service_namespace="$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", db_error!="", db_system_name!=""}[$__rate_interval]),
                "database",
                "/",
                "db_system_name",
                "span_name"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (database) (
            label_join(
                rate(db_client_operation_duration_seconds_count{service_namespace="$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", db_system_name!=""}[$__rate_interval]),
                "database",
                "/",
                "db_system_name",
                "span_name"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (database) (
            label_join(
                rate(db_client_operation_duration_seconds_count{service_namespace="$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", db_system_name!=""}[$__rate_interval]),
                "database",
                "/",
                "db_system_name",
                "span_name"
            )
        )
    )

histogram_quantile(
    0.99,
    sum by (le, database) (
        label_join(
        rate(db_client_operation_duration_seconds_bucket{service_namespace="$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", db_system_name!=""}[5m]),
            "database",
            "/",
            "db_system_name",
            "span_name"
        )
    )
)

panels.title: Outbound Databases

panels.description: Traces containing a span emitted by the service

For JVM based services like Java or Kotlin, the JVM metrics.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/runtime/jvm-metrics/
panels.title: JVM

list.description: Values instrospected from traces, filtering on the selected service namespace..
list.label: service.name
list.name: service_name

title: Lightweight APM for OpenTelemetry
